A modern ügyfelek a megfelelő tanúsítványt fogják megkapni az alternatív tanúsítványok listájáról, ha egyezés található."

advanced.detail: Direct requests to different services based on port, Host header, or request path
advanced.help1:
If Request Host and/or Path are specified, connections to HTTP listening ports will be routed to the appropriate target based on the request.
For example, you could use this to send traffic for domain1.com to a different service than domain2.com, or domain3.com/admin to a different service than domain3.com.
advanced.help2:
Matching requests will be sent to the Target Service on the Target Port.
If that is not set, then the Default Target port for the Source Port.  If that is also not set, then the Source Port.

setup.prefix: Multiple server containers can be deployed on different hosts so that {appName} keeps running even if one of the hosts fail.
setup.suffix: for information on setup and usage.

commercial.content: At PAAS Labs we provide commercial, enterprise-grade support for {appName}, including an available 24x7 support team, and priority bug fixes. In addition we provide implementation, integration and consulting services for organizations looking to implement and scale {appName}. For more information on any of these services, please email our sales team: sales@PAAS.com

environment.content:
{appName} supports grouping resources into multiple environments. Each one gets its own set of services and infrastructure resources, and is owned by one or more GitHub users, teams or organizations.

For example, you might create separate "dev", "test", and "production" environments to keep things isolated from each other, and give "dev" access to your entire organization but restrict the "production" environment to a smaller team.

host.content:
Before adding your first service or launching a container, you must add at least a single Linux host that supports Docker {minVersion} or higher and be able to reach the {appName} server via HTTP. {appName} supports adding Linux hosts in the form of a virtual or physical
    machine from any public cloud providers, privately hosted clouds, or even bare metal servers.

graphic2.link:
about using {appName} Visit our docs.
or check out our getting started documentation.

content.paragraph1: {appName} is an open source software platform that implements a purpose-built infrastructure for running containers in production. Docker containers, as an increasingly popular application workload, create new requirements in infrastructure services such as networking, storage, load balancer, security, service discovery, and resource management.

A service is simply a group of containers created from the same Docker image but extends Docker's "link" concept to leverage {appName}'s lightweight distributed DNS service for service discovery. Services can be added individually or by deploying an item from the Catalog.
content.paragraph2: A service is also capable of leveraging other {appName} built-in services such as load balancers, health monitoring, upgrade support, and high availability.

stacks.header: Mik azok a Kötegek és Szolgáltatások?
stacks.noHosts: Jelenleg nincsenek hosztjaid. Kérlek adj hozzá egy hosztot mielőtt szolgáltatást adnál hozzá.

infra.paragraph: Az Infrastruktúra kötegek új képességeket, pl új számítógépfürt rendszereket, adattárolási és hálózati szolgáltatókat ad az {appName} alkalmazáshoz.

service.paragraph1:
A service is simply a group of containers created from the same Docker image but extends Docker's 'link' concept to leverage {appName}'s lightweight distributed DNS service for service discovery.
Services can be added individually or by deploying an item from the Catalog.
service.paragraph2: A service is also capable of leveraging other {appName} built-in services such as load balancers, health monitoring, upgrade support, and high availability.

receiver.content: Receiver hooks give you a URL that can be hit to trigger an action inside of {appName}.

badTld.alert: The .local Top-Level Domain is reserved by RFC6762 for Multicast DNS. Using this as your Registration URL is not recommended and may cause DNS resolution issues. Please choose a different hostname or IP.

helpText.static1: Don't include /v1 or any other path, but if you are doing
helpText.static2: in front of {appName}, be sure to use https://.

dashboard.content: A Kubernetes irányítópult egy általános célú, web alapú felhasználói felület a Kubernetes fürtökhöz. Lehetővé teszi a felhasználóknak hogy alkalmazásokat kezeljenek a fürtben és hibaelhárítást végezhessenek, valamint kezelhessék magát a fürtöt.

driverCustom.step1: Start up a Linux machine somewhere and install a supported version of Docker on it.
driverCustom.step2: Make sure any security groups or firewalls allow traffic:
driverCustom.step2li: From and To all other hosts on UDP ports 500 and 4500 (for IPsec networking)
driverCustom.step3: Optional: Add labels to be applied to the host.
driverCustom.step4: Specify the public IP that should be registered for this host. If left empty, PAAS will auto-detect the IP to use. This generally works for machines with unique public IPs, but will not work if the machine is behind a firewall/NAT or if it is the same machine that is running the {PAASImage} container.

step5Close.part1: Click close below.  The new host should pop up on the

driverCustom.step5Copy: Copy, paste, and run the command below to register the host with

windows.step1: Start up a Windows Server 2016 machine somewhere and install the latest version of Docker on it.
windows.step3: Copy, paste, and run the command below in PowerShell to start the {appName} agent.

windowsSteps.step1: Start up a Windows Server 2016 machine somewhere and install a supported version of Docker on it.
windowsSteps.step2: Check and install RemoteAccess and Routing in Windows features:
windowsSteps.step2Note: Note: Windows machine will need to be rebooted if the applications were installed.
windowsSteps.step3: Specify a unique subnet for the Windows host. In order to support an overlay network in Windows, each host in the environment must have a unique subnet.
windowsSteps.step4: Specify the router IP for the host's subnet. This IP is used to forward network traffic between the different hosts.
windowsSteps.step5: Specify the public IP that should be registered for this host. If left empty, PAAS will auto-detect the IP to use. This generally works for machines with unique public IPs, but will not work if the machine is behind a firewall/NAT or if it is the same machine that is running the {PAASImage} container.
windowsSteps.step6: Optional: Add labels to be applied to the host.
windowsSteps.step7: Copy, paste, and run the command below in PowerShell to start the {appName} agent.

index.alert: Nincs aktív környezet. Létre kell hoznod vagy aktiválnod kell egyet mielőtt bármi mást csinálnál.
index.subtext:
{appName} supports grouping resources into multiple environments. Each one gets its own set of services and infrastructure resources, and is owned by one or more users or groups.

For example, you might create separate "dev", "test", and "production" environments to keep things isolated from each other, and give "dev" access to your entire organization but restrict the "production" environment to a smaller team.

indexTemplate.subtext:
An environment template allows users to define a different combination of infrastructure services to be deployed.

The infrastructure services includes but not limited to container orchestration (i.e. cattle, kubernetes, mesos, swarm, networking) or PAAS services (i.e healthcheck, dns, metadata, scheduling, service discovery and storage)

body.noData: Nincs még egyetlen környezet sablonod sem

telemetryOpt.subtext:
Rancher Labs szeretne névtelen információkat gyűjteni a telepítésed beállításairól hogy jobbá tudja tenni a {appName} alkalmazást.
Az adataid nem lesznek megosztva senki mással és a konkrét erőforrás nevét vagy címét sem gyűjtik össze.
